abstract: The content view for the menu item.
overview:
## Discussion

A menu item with a view does not draw its title, state, font, or other standard drawing attributes, and assigns drawing responsibility entirely to the view. Keyboard equivalents and type-select continue to use the key equivalent and title as normal. For more details, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/MenuList/MenuList.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000032i]

By default, a menu item has a `nil` view.

# view

**Instance Property**

The content view for the menu item.

## Declaration

```swift
var view: NSView? { get set }
```

## Discussion

A menu item with a view does not draw its title, state, font, or other standard drawing attributes, and assigns drawing responsibility entirely to the view. Keyboard equivalents and type-select continue to use the key equivalent and title as normal. For more details, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/MenuList/MenuList.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000032i]

By default, a menu item has a `nil` view.
title: view
